static.name: static
static.comment:
Creates a static instance of the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer class.

The lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.bufferUsage is set to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.BufferUsage.Static. This means that the data contents of the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer rarely changes. This allows the underlying implementation to optimize for this case.

This does not mean that lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.setData, and lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.replaceData cannot be called multiple times, but doing so could have a negative performance impact. If the data is changing every frame or so the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer should be created using the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.VertexBuffer-dynamic constructor.

dynamic.name: dynamic
dynamic.comment:
Creates a dynamic instance of the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer class.

The lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.bufferUsage is set to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.BufferUsage.Dynamic. This means that the data contents of the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer changes frequently, every frame or so. This allows the underlying implementation to optimize for this case.

If lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.setData, or lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.replaceData are not being called on a frequent basis, then the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer should be created using the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.VertexBuffer-static constructor.

setData.name: setData
setData.comment: Sets the entire contents of the buffer with the values contained in lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.setData.data.

replaceData.name: replaceData
replaceData.comment:
Replaces a portion of the buffer with the values contained in lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.replaceData.data.

The contents are replaced starting at the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.replaceData.offset in bytes up to the size of the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.replaceData.data array.

dispose.name: dispose
dispose.comment: Immediately releases the unmanaged resources used by this object.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of lithium_ion/lithium_graphics.VertexBuffer.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

dispose.name: dispose
dispose.comment: Immediately releases the unmanaged resources used by this object.
